intro: Hieracium florentinum subsp. insigne, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of the genus Hieracium. This subspecies is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and blooms from late spring to early autumn.
